channel.title: Comments on: Is Your Landing Page Good Enough to Get Into YC?
channel.description: Steal the Secrets of the Best Marketers on the Internet by Studying Their Landing Pages

item.title: By: Gregory Magarshak
item.dc:creator: Gregory Magarshak
item.description: Now this is an amazing list. And I am not just saying that because I was smacking my lips pleased that nearly every point I read, we did on our own website (qbix.com , though I often hear thay our colorful graphics are very cheesy). I am also saying that because these are the things that actually MATTER, all in one place! With the actual reactions of the author, in plain self-centered English we can all understand and identify with :)
item.content:encoded: Now this is an amazing list. And I am not just saying that because I was smacking my lips pleased that nearly every point I read, we did on our own website (qbix.com , though I often hear thay our colorful graphics are very cheesy). I am also saying that because these are the things that actually MATTER, all in one place! With the actual reactions of the author, in plain self-centered English we can all understand and identify with :)

item.title: By: Mark Hope
item.dc:creator: Mark Hope
item.description:
Very good article. Great points that are well illustrated and explained. I hate articles with what sounds like a good idea - but no example or illustration.
Well done.
item.content:encoded:
Very good article. Great points that are well illustrated and explained. I hate articles with what sounds like a good idea – but no example or illustration.

Well done.

item.title: By: FG Newsletter #344
item.dc:creator: FG Newsletter #344
item.description: […] Is Your Landing Page Good Enough To Get Into Y Combinator? If you would like Y Combinator to take notice of your startup’s landing page, here are 50 important lessons you can take home to improve it. “The most important is to explain what the hell your site is about.” […]
item.content:encoded: […] Is Your Landing Page Good Enough To Get Into Y Combinator? If you would like Y Combinator to take notice of your startup’s landing page, here are 50 important lessons you can take home to improve it. “The most important is to explain what the hell your site is about.” […]

item.title: By: Goncalo
item.dc:creator: Goncalo
item.description: Awesome, research and valuable feedback. I will consider them in my website.
item.content:encoded:
Awesome, research and valuable feedback.
I will consider them in my website.

item.title: By: David Oudiette
item.dc:creator: David Oudiette
item.description:
Glad I could help. :)
Good luck with your application!
item.content:encoded:
Glad I could help. :)

Good luck with your application!

item.title: By: Anamika Sethi
item.dc:creator: Anamika Sethi
item.description: As a start-up applying for Y-combinator's Summer 2016 batch, I came across this article at a very valuable time. We're constantly a/b testing different versions of our landing page to see what works best. Right now we're running the best performing version to date. However, this article uncovered at least 8 more things we can change and refine in some way. Thanks, David!
item.content:encoded: As a start-up applying for Y-combinator’s Summer 2016 batch, I came across this article at a very valuable time. We’re constantly a/b testing different versions of our landing page to see what works best. Right now we’re running the best performing version to date. However, this article uncovered at least 8 more things we can change and refine in some way. Thanks, David!

item.title: By: Moses (Xendit)
item.dc:creator: Moses (Xendit)
item.description:
Appreciate the candid thoughts on us :) Great food for thought on how to improve.
Cheers!
item.content:encoded:
Appreciate the candid thoughts on us :) Great food for thought on how to improve.
